Wyder ist myn bitt, das tu na fridden, so vill durch gott moegelich, arbeitz, und laiß mich verstain, ab uch myn letste brieb behandicht.

My willing service of my small means is always available to you.
Dear Heinrich, this my good friend often tells me how I have a good friend in himself. Dear Heinrich, this my good friend often tells me how I have a good friend in himself.Therefore, he often asked me to write something to him, and he would be happy to take it with him.
As to what I would write without fail, I would tell of the health of all, to the praise of the Lord. As to what I would write without fail, I would tell of the health of all, to the praise of the Lord.What more pleasing enterprise could there be among us than to take up arms against the Turks, which he will tell you more about verbally. As to what I would write without fail, I would tell of the health of all, to the praise of the Lord.What more pleasing enterprise could there be among us than to take up arms against the Turks, which he will tell you more about verbally.May you give him good advice about his dealings, and I beg you on his behalf.
Furthermore, my request is that you work for peace as much as possible with God's help, and let me know how you treated my last letter.
Send me the annotations on John's canonical letter, for I lent the last one to a Augustinian monk in friendship, and I cannot get it back, and whatever else you have prepared.Send me the annotations on John's canonical letter, for I lent the last one to a Augustinian monk in friendship, and I cannot get it back, and whatever else you have prepared.And offer something to me in return for what you would like from me.Send me the annotations on John's canonical letter, for I lent the last one to a Augustinian monk in friendship, and I cannot get it back, and whatever else you have prepared.And offer something to me in return for what you would like from me.I will always be willing and more in the same.
Greet all good friends for me.

Dated at Cologne, 12th August, 32nd year.
